next_steps: Ask about location, type, and duration of pain.
Check for associated symptoms: shortness of breath, sweating, nausea, pain radiating to arm/jaw.
If severe, sudden, or with red flag symptoms, call 911 immediately.
If mild and no risk factors, rest and monitor.
Ask about onset, triggers, and associated symptoms (wheezing, chest pain, swelling).
If severe, sudden, or with blue lips/face, call 911 immediately.
If mild, rest and monitor. Use inhaler if prescribed.
Apply firm pressure with a clean cloth.
Call 911 if bleeding does not stop after 10 minutes or is spurting.
Cool the burn with running water for at least 10 minutes.
Do not apply ice or ointments.
Cover with a clean, non-stick bandage.
Call 911 for deep, large, or facial burns.
Look for swelling, hives, or difficulty breathing.
Call 911 if symptoms are severe or involve breathing/swallowing.
